clinical_study.brief_title: Intraoperative Lung Ultrasound in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Benefit of Intraoperative Lung Ultrasound in Pediatric Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators hypothesized that perioperative lung ultrasound would be beneficial in pediatric patients undergoing cardiac surgery compared to those who did not receive lung ultrasound.

primary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative incidence of pulse oximetry (SpO2) ≤ 95% (or 10% below the baseline value)
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the induction of general anesthesia until the end of the surgery, up to 24 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative incidence of SpO2 ≤ 95% (or 10% below the baseline value)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first day after surgery
within the first day after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood (PaO2) from arterial blood gas analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the induction of general anesthesia until the end of the surgery, up to 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood (PaO2) from arterial blood gas analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first day after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Initial SpO2 on arriving at pediatric intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the end of the surgery until postoperative 1 hour

secondary_outcome.measure: Days needed to wean from mechanical ventilation

arm_group.description: No intervention during the perioperative period. Perform lung ultrasound twice only for the diagnostic purpose at the end of surgery and 6 to 12 hours after surgery in the intensive care unit.

Perform lung ultrasound three times during the perioperative period; after the induction of general anesthesia, at the end of surgery, and 6 to 12 hours after surgery in the intensive care unit. According to the lung ultrasound finding, conduct appropriate interventions such as, alveolar recruitment maneuver for atelectasis, or chest tube insertion for pneumothorax.

intervention.description: Lung ultrasound with appropriate interventions depending on the ultrasound finding

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Acyanotic congenital heart disease patients undergoing cardiac surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of surgery on the lungs
- Cyanotic congenital heart disease
- Abnormal preoperative chest radiograph findings including atelectasis, pneumothorax, pleural effusion, and pneumonia
- Considered inappropriate by the investigator
